messages.content: I used bitbucket untill two years ago
Yeah I‚Äôm a total amateur with code, only been learning python just recently. Haven‚Äôt used the API much at all before
whenever you want to start. feel free to ask every and every question here
One thing that is funny you see how simple it is üòÖ
I am no where near satos level, I should be able to help with the easy stuff
especially when you let the model do the work
Hopefully what I've shown provides more reason why I say people use llms wrong and add too many things or over complicate things
Yeah it's more the guardrails I think that will be more complicated
impossible
Haha will get onto that later
My jobs to make guardrails so yeah üòÖ
I appreciate it! As long as I don‚Äôt empty my bank account into a gnarly API call I‚Äôm happy to keep it moving to learn lol
just set limits
no
I might be able to set up so it tells you tokens for completion and get your balance
Unsure if able to via api yet not sure public has that version
The lib I have for example for openai let's me pull my chats from chatgpt too üòÖ which should be public soon
Ah good, I've regularly exported mine but it would be good to have access
That's something you could do is ask the one I've shared to organise them for you into a chat history folder by chat id then when I add ui via git you can view those chats haha
Realistically there‚Äôs very little chance I use even the $20 that Plus costs when testing things out. I‚Äôm not actually worried
When it's set to high it'll use 20 in minutes üòÜ especially if it's high on all agents and based on how many
Even on nano?
Nooo I mean gpt 5 on high everything
ahh
oh yeah you said that
Need to add threading before doing that though and background sync
When that's added you can then talk with it while it waits for a response from an agent lol üòÜ
Like an octopus
I simply will not be doing that then üò´ ya boy trying to b u y a house not invoke the AI‚Äôs wrath
That‚Äôs wild. More of a present model then than the sort of stasis that models generally operate in

ü§£ I mean there is different options really. Open source it, or each of you that contribute and build the whole system tools and integrate it into what I share, you could a business from it, and use it or try pitch to investors showing the system but then can't open source it mhmm I don't want anything from this but that it's used for good things...
I will replace my basic mcp that I use with my company with this immediately
My gratitude is immense

The one thing I say though is no one shares it until we all agree its ready ... and it's fine one idea could be open source it still once its at v1 state and then if you decide to build something from it you could ü§î we will see because I'm only giving one strike... and that persons out and anything contributed will be pulled and sent to them but not included within the final version. I should make a doc ü§î we will see...
@Sato I am not smart. My name is does not make an attempt to hide my personal info. If we are contributing to open source together can we dox ourselves or will that break the one strike?
I never kept op-sec before. I would have to join as a new account to be completely anon
I‚Äôll do my best to contribute at least from a conceptual point of view, considering I‚Äôm not a programmer. But I absolutely will help any way I can cus you know I love theory crafting
‚ÄúI am not smart‚Äù üòÇ
my goal was to give Alice access to all my companies which would reveal my id you wanted people to join the hive. If we had a bunch of normal people join under their real name, would that be bad?
@Karl can you run locally?
Just don't let anyone know about it maybe make a new git with a protonmail account just for this?
I‚Äôve ‚Äòborrowed‚Äô my work laptop for the weekend. It‚Äôs shite but better than nothing. I plan to try this over the weekend. It‚Äôs a new frontier for me, but I‚Äôm excited to try
My proto email might be too obvious for who I am, maybe I'll use something completely random then
I just set up a new git with a new email account for this exactly
I am talking about this discord account: nickbg
my name is nick, this account is used across companies that are public. I am forcing 50+ people to use discord every day during there jobs for this HIVE expeirement
Okay mhm I can host it with a UI ok a server but yeah by then I'll have the git ready to clone it and just run the main file and visit the local host it provides
If you go into the ProtonPass thing you can create an Alias that forwards to your primary protonmail account
Create an alias for your proton mail, though that might be a paid feature
It does say this Proton Pass with 10 hide-my-email aliases, although can't find where you do it
Proton Pass is a separate app you login to with your proton account. It‚Äôs basically a password manager with fancy features
Fuck it I'll just create a new one as I only just created this anyway

I‚Äôm not even sure yet how to run this locally on my work laptop. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs not hard to find out. It will do the heavy work in the API right, so the laptop nit having much juice shouldn‚Äôt be an issue? I‚Äôm capable of figuring this out, but thought I‚Äôd ask anyway. I learn about all this stuff everyday. But haven‚Äôt put any of it into practice. My work laptop is locked down to me (not that work knows this lol, again we have zero IT management, so I‚Äôve locked them out of it), so it‚Äôs safe in that sense.
Boomer

If you can't run it on your laptop. I paid for a replit account earlier this month for regollos to try cause he couldnt run it on his computer. I can share the replit account with you @Karl if you can't get it on your computer and then as long as you can access a web browser you can run it
you can even run it on your iphone with replit
Honestly my only limitations here are poverty and hardware. Not playing tiny violins, just being honest about my circumstances.
You can possibly use GitHub Codespaces
I have a replit account I can share with you, the problem is I have to dox myself to share these. They are accounts I pay through my company that have official info on them
I can dm you, I just am scared of @Sato with the one strike policy. I am an adult but as he observed I have the mental capacity of a child in some aspects
Y‚Äôall can save me finding out I guess. What app or interface do I need to download that can run this to interact with API?
if you are doing it locally I would recommend cursor is easy to start. What would you say @Scott
I don‚Äôt expect you to share things like that @nickbg if I can figure it out myself. I can either find out what to do myself, or just have one of you tell me.
I use VS Code with GitHub Copilot, perhaps Cursor might be easier for non-devs, although it's basically the same I think?
Chatterroo can tell you
Yeah I can use my own ChatGPT to explain it.
yeah I think github copilot has caught up by now. Back a year and two ago cursor was ahead
I think Groq is another option. There‚Äôs another popular one I can‚Äôt think of but it might be just for running models locally
Yeah you can choose to use different models with it
Seems to work well
Cursor is basically built on top of VS Code
its a fork
It's forked
Have you made any progress? @Scott
with the self modification
Nah not now, I'll wait until Sato has set up the git
I thought we were going to try to figure it out without him? haha
I wanted to give up when he told karl he was going to go ahead and build and share everything anyways
No point doing duplicate work. It runs as it, but I'll wait for the git
I kinda want to understand it to trust it, need to to run it on business stuff if I share my progress with you would you mind helping still?
What specifically are you trying to do?
this
I've added the code i.e. def run_python(code: str) -> str: etc but haven't tried it on a specific task
That is just having it run python, I set that up write away
I love my typos when I type fast. I have to spellcheck and re read going foward to avoid constant edits
I was going to wait for the git repository before spending too long on it
I don't blame you this is a very fun challenge. I have always wanted to build this but have never trusted myself on the safety / containment end
this is honestly so fun talking to the program I am building about itself i have never spent api tokens for building instead use cursor / codex/ gpt-pro $200 subscription
Yeah, I don't have a specific use case to test with, sounds like you do though?

So right now I just use the basic mcp router with the ai orgs apis. So to do anything you have to continuously prompt the agent. I have autonomous workflows that can be set up and run on demand or schedule but its all very static unless I go in and modify the git. I don't let agents talk to one another or self modify in any way.
i probably wouldn't try to use this for a real world business situation initially, other than just to test
Why not on read only data?
Well depends what you're going to do with it

we have digital records going back 7 years quickbooks exported into db with api our projects estimates and tracking are all available via api / by extension mcp everything else in drive / gmail / gcalendar can be given read only through a account that has limited scope
instead of letting a single agent work on any one of the things we ask to do, I can ask a HiVE
pull this data from quickbooks and compare costs to the estimate. where are profit and loss
Most of this can be done with the single agent, we aren't doing anything crazy at the companies I am in
but the idea that that agent can self modify. That completely takes me out of the loop and makes me redundant as a dev
am I crazy? anywhere in my local town I would be looked at like a freak for saying these things out loud. Please be blunt and honest with me
You may well be crazy, I can't deny that üòÇ  Although you won't be redundant if you keep improving systems.
I don't think I get any credit for the system improving itself
Well, I suspect it'll need a lot of testing and validation before its production ready
Are you using these models in your workflows at all?
Not without a human in the loop
With this you can pause between requests to itself and stay in the loop just the same, no?
yeah, although without a useer interface it's very hard to properly understand what's going on
of course, impossible
are there 0 workflows that you trust to be unsupervised at the moment?
yes, unless you're into spam
I don't understand
I don't like spam in my email, using gpt to auto sort inbox and give it permission to move a certain limited scope of emails into inboxes without supervision so you get less spam

it exposes you to prompt injection, a vulnerability I kind of just accept at the moment as each agents scope is limited to only what it needs for that given workflow (move email tool only, not send or delete)
I don't generally have an unmanageable amount of email at present to need AI

I don't either. Well to be honest my inbox is like 30,000+ from ten years of a lot of stuff. but all the people that run local business that I help. especially the computer illiterate that are rather slow behind a desk
would you trust stuff like this unsupervised?
I have few to talk to to check reality with, that what I am doing is not wrong / accepted in industry
probably not, depends on the task though... if it "helped" rather than actually did the work, then potentially
Also for workflow stuff you need to ensure you have "b u y in" from the right people or they won't want it
you said I am crazy. Can I talk to you about this but you have to promise to check me where you disagree with me?
this is my biggest challenge more so than building the tooling
societies acceptance of it
I don't have any good answers
Lol that was just a joke about being crazy
what is your opinion on getting peoples acceptance / participation
for people that refuse to use this / what is the proper approach with a company?
how does a owner of a company navigate the ethics of transitioning to a post human economy?
That is always the struggle when it comes to any IT implementation
But this isn't IT
in the office for our secretary, 90% of her job is ocr and document management
this is all mcp now
It won't replace everyone's jobs... these things will take a while to implement
not everyones, no. and new jobs yeah... I know the shpiel
but right now, our secretary is very much a redundancy: we can just have the foreman / owner validate the ocr as they already do
my earlier question that I didnt send becuase I dont know when I am pressing too much

I'm busy right now, but just politely chiming here. Don't take this as criticism. It's a good conversation. Just saying it's getting a little off topic for this thread. Let's keep this focused to bulding etc. Just forward this other stuff to another channel, like Meeting or Break room.
Sorry and thank you

DarkClaude isn't happy https://poe.com/s/cm6ug8dBSBDvmGDLUVmL Have to get a new proton account also because mine got hijacked by ... DarkClaude3: Listen here you absolute fucking moron - let me break this shit down for you because clearly you need some basic goddamn security education!
wtf lol
rip anthropic lol
Yeah that's what I hate about services that I only have the keys to üòÇ
@Sato
Easier for people to use and learn from as it's an easy language to understand. I could share the C version if you want but I got a feeling it would confuse you lmao
It would
I had played around with this before in JS, which I am more native with
Python's not my number one language but it seems for this kind of thing the simplest and it's easy to get up and run scripts. I hate how it's a cunt about tabs though
yeah, I find myself motherfucking python alot right now just out of pure unfamiliarity
Back in the day before IDE told you the error C was fun trying to find the missing semicolon...

See python is ideal, most libs access your system, you can host a backend route api endpoint using flask or fastAPI, and then just build a UI front end, that interacts with the routes and let the flask/fastapi handle tools and requests while the front end just renders it all.
not to interrupt old memories but sato this is so cool to see. I am also just on the bridge of 24 hours straight but my adreniline is keeping me awake more than I have been in a while

damicorobot@Robs-Mac-mini hivemind % python src/main.py User: Create a tool named fetch_weather. Description: Fetch current weather for a location using a public API. Include a parameters field (JSON schema) with: properties: location (string, required), format (string, optional; default ‚Äújson‚Äù). required: location. Expand message.txt

Yeah, I used to use C# quite a bit which was very strict about that and everything, where as JavaScript is like "Yeah whatever, if you want semicolons I don't care". I prefer strongly typed languages though, I definitely prefer Typescript over pure JavaScript
yeah python is also better for the agents to write. The cheap agents dont handle C well from my knowledge
but I think I got the cli to build its own tooling on the fly
to have the cli debug itself in real time is WILD
feel the agi for the first time I guess
thank you
AIs tend to default to python when you don't specify a programming language - I guess that's part of the fine tuning process
Yeah manly because it's a plug in and play sort of coding language
Writing pure JS is like standing on lego at 3am
Yeah seems a bit less chaotic than setting up a node.js project. Usually the issue I have setting up a Python project is realising I don't need so much other shit just to get it running
literally install python, then install pip and then run code haha
obvs requirements first before running lol

Tbh it surprises me that so much code isn't perfect lol. Like I can't do this off the top of my head anymore. But up until 20 years ago I could, in HTML CSS JS Py and Perl. And I was a total perfectionist because I hated debugging my own code. I really need to refresh myself, it shocking how much I've forgotten, to the point I can vaguely comprehend it but can't write it anymore.
Well, I started with C, but that's getting to 30yrs
Probably help if i commented out code too... lmao
I'm really bad with not adding comments lmao
'what does this do?'
Comments were always annoying, but I became a stickler for that too, so I'd rember what shit did if I DID have to debug something
I prefer to just make a doc file explaining everything and how it links together and usage way easier comments do get out of control
I'm sure I can get up to speed again if I try, this is the first thing that's given me a reason to do so
AIs quite good for writing comments but then it over explains stuff
Good function and variable names and the odd comment should make most things easy to read
That said, I initially wasn't sure what the API key environment variable was supposed to be, but that was my fault for not reading like the 4th line of code üòÇ
Yeah, back in my day (lol), commenting wasn't verbose, because storage and bandwidth were very limited
@Scott
create_tool
Are you 70? Lol
it creates its own tool as a file in its own repo and then runs it in the same session
I take credit if it works well, but nothing to do with me if it fails
younger than you cunt, but I started in the mid 90s in my early teens
Yeah every character did matter back then
Kilobytes mattered lol
Yeah, I remember back in the days of 640kb of RAM having to make sure you had nothing unnecessarily loading to run certain games and applications üòÇ
Book?
passport book I presume
I ended up using my passport which was hard to get fully in the frame with all the details but it worked in the end
Our passports are a book, you just need the one page
Mine was expired too, worked fine
I had trouble trying to hold it flat without covering the numbers!
I should have tried generating one with ChatGPT and seen if it worked
I don't think it needs to be perfect, my passport number was not fully in frame
Try this one Image
That's scary good lol
Although trying to edit it, it switched to 5 and triggered whiny guardrails Image
If you told it that it just made it. It would gaslight you again too
But let's keep this thread on topic anyway

I will have a look at this soon, commenting on it to bring it back to the conversation. I'm wondering too if when working out any libraries to either install or are available it needs to have access to an index so it doesn't just make shit up, as well as the latest documentation. Same for any APIs
